title: Carving workflow on OSX (observed in Monterey)
body:
<!---
Thank you for letting us know that there is a problem in ilastik.
Filling out this template as detailed as possible will help us to improve the software.
--->


## Describe the bug
When starting the carving workflow it will complain about loading openGL

## Expected behavior
We know that we can't show the GL view, but normal carving should work.

Monkeypatching `ctypes` as described [here](https://github.com/PixarAnimationStudios/USD/issues/1372#issuecomment-912254279) makes it work again/

## To Reproduce

Create a new carving project

## Error message/traceback

If applicable, please add tracebacks with formatting, such as

```pytb
Starting ilastik from "/.../mambaforge/envs/ilastik-app/lib/python3.7".
ERROR 2022-03-08 08:35:49,451 log_exception 69078 8641803776 Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/.../mambaforge/envs/ilastik-app/lib/python3.7/site-packages/OpenGL/platform/darwin.py", line 38, in GL
    mode=ctypes.RTLD_GLOBAL
  File "/.../mambaforge/envs/ilastik-app/lib/python3.7/site-packages/OpenGL/platform/ctypesloader.py", line 36, in loadLibrary
    return _loadLibraryWindows(dllType, name, mode)
  File "/.../mambaforge/envs/ilastik-app/lib/python3.7/site-packages/OpenGL/platform/ctypesloader.py", line 89, in _loadLibraryWindows
    return dllType( name, mode )
  File "/.../mambaforge/envs/ilastik-app/lib/python3.7/ctypes/__init__.py", line 364, in __init__
    self._handle = _dlopen(self._name, mode)
OSError: ("dlopen(OpenGL, 0x000A): tried: '/.../mambaforge/envs/ilastik-app/lib/OpenGL' (no such file), '/.../mambaforge/envs/ilastik-app/lib/OpenGL' (no such file), '/.../mambaforge/envs/ilastik-app/lib/python3.7/lib-dynload/../../OpenGL' (no such file), '/.../mambaforge/envs/ilastik-app/lib/OpenGL' (no such file), '/.../mambaforge/envs/ilastik-app/bin/../lib/OpenGL' (no such file), 'OpenGL' (no such file), '/usr/local/lib/OpenGL' (no such file), '/usr/lib/OpenGL' (no such file), '/.../OpenGL' (no such file), '/usr/local/lib/OpenGL' (no such file), '/usr/lib/OpenGL' (no such file)", 'OpenGL', None)

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

```

## Desktop (please complete the following information):
 - ilastik version: 1.4.0b24
 - OS: OSX Monterey
 
 <!---
For developers only:
in order to reproduce the environment properly it is of great help to know the exact commits for each of the main packages.

for d in ilastik lazyflow volumina; do
    (cd $d && echo "$d ilastik/$d@$(git rev-parse --verify HEAD)")
done

Just run the the preceding for loop in your shell from your ilastik-meta folder and paste the output below, after the comment mark.
Example output:

ilastik ilastik/ilastik@b060889258b8e8e5a8291d1c391dcfeb80474131
lazyflow ilastik/lazyflow@f1eaa478381ca27cf1ee43e4a26c96175a914073
volumina ilastik/volumina@0431fcefd75ecba2ddc3fe1fe86b47f65132f76b
--->

title: Relative paths stored relative to cwd :o // Relative paths for image files not possible in Windows
body:
<!---
Thank you for letting us know that there is a problem in ilastik.
Filling out this template as detailed as possible will help us to improve the software.
--->


## Describe the bug
I think this is just an oversight, fixing it seems straight forward. But it opens up deeper questions, like why would we ever store project data relative to the cwd, or why is this fallback even there?

One side effect of this is, that for windows users, that have installed ilastik in the default location, it will never (well, the data is usually never further down in the hierarchy wrt the ilastik installation on `C:\Program Files....`

## Expected behavior
Links to data should be relative to the project file

## To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
just store your project in a location different from the cwd for ilasitk, and observe the behavior in the data selection applet.


## Desktop (please complete the following information):
 - ilastik version: 1.4.0x
 
 <!---
For developers only:
in order to reproduce the environment properly it is of great help to know the exact commits for each of the main packages.

for d in ilastik lazyflow volumina; do
    (cd $d && echo "$d ilastik/$d@$(git rev-parse --verify HEAD)")
done

Just run the the preceding for loop in your shell from your ilastik-meta folder and paste the output below, after the comment mark.
Example output:

ilastik ilastik/ilastik@b060889258b8e8e5a8291d1c391dcfeb80474131
lazyflow ilastik/lazyflow@f1eaa478381ca27cf1ee43e4a26c96175a914073
volumina ilastik/volumina@0431fcefd75ecba2ddc3fe1fe86b47f65132f76b
--->

title: segfault on Project -> Save as
body:
<!---
Thank you for letting us know that there is a problem in ilastik.
Filling out this template as detailed as possible will help us to improve the software.
--->


## Describe the bug

When saving a project to a _different folder_ location via _Project -> Save as_, with _relative_ dataset links, ilastik will segfault during reopening the resaved project. This is because it tries to open a `QMessageBox` from a non-QT thread, when discovering it cannot find the file:

threaded saving here: https://github.com/ilastik/ilastik/blob/dff831b0699c68edd91380de77826c327f59abbb/ilastik/shell/gui/ilastikShell.py#L1735-L1736

and construction of `QMessageBox` here:

<details>

https://github.com/ilastik/ilastik/blob/dff831b0699c68edd91380de77826c327f59abbb/ilastik/applets/dataSelection/dataSelectionSerializer.py#L253-L267

</details>

## Expected behavior

Should obviously _not_ crash. Also, while at it, it should probably do something to the dataset links as well, otherwise it renders this functionality with relative links useless...

## To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Within the whatever worklow
1. Add some [2d/3d/4d/5d] data in the data selection applet, make sure the link to the dataset is _relative_
2. save as -> :boom:

If applicable, please add tracebacks with formatting, such as

title: classifier retrains from all zeros data if raw data not accessible anymore
body: right now (`1.4.0b7`) if a trained classifier hasn't been saved (say pixel classification), ilastik will try to retrain in headless mode. If the data is not available, it will be connected to "pseudo" sources with all zeros. It shouldn't retrain in that case but rather fail with helpful error message.

title: Incompatibility of ilp between versions 1.3.2 and 1.3.3
body:
Dear Ilastik team


## Describe the bug
I have a Pixel classification Project created in Ilastik 1.3.2, in summer 2019. This project successfully works in Ilastik 1.3.2 and is perfectly functional. It is also used to run Ilastik 1.3.2 headless. Its name is ``pixel-class-wednesday.ilp`` It does a pixel classification on z-stacks on images such as http://idr.openmicroscopy.org/webclient/?show=image-6001240
When I try to open the ``pixel-class-wednesday.ilp`` in Ilastik 1.3.3, I get following error message. (see screenshot1 below). 
Note that the Ilastik 1.3.3 and Ilastik 1.3.2 are running on the same machine (Mac OS High Sierra), and the paths to raw data as saved in the project are valid.
Treid to attach the ``pixel-class-wednesday.ilp`` here too, but github does not support attaching of such files. Happy to give you the file by other means if you tell me how.



![Screen Shot 2020-04-03 at 10 27 02](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2478303/78352625-8aac8280-75a0-11ea-9785-b17fb52bbb51.png)




## Expected behavior
Ilastik 1.3.3 should be opening the ``pixel-class-wednesday.ilp`` exactly as Ilastik 1.3.2 does. There is no reason not to - the environment is the same, all that changed is the Ilastik version. A minor version change should not break the compatibility.

## To Reproduce
1. Open the attached ``pixel-class-wednesday.ilp`` in Ilastik 1.3.3.
2. Observe the error.

## Error message/traceback

I am adding what I found in ``Ilastik_log.txt`` in a collapsible section with markdown below
<details>
  <summary>Click to expand!</summary>

```

title: Multicut: Saving multicut projects broken with pandas >=0.24
body:
<!---
Thank you for letting us know that there is a problem in ilastik.
Filling out this template as detailed as possible will help us to improve the software.
--->


## Describe the bug
Once a classifier is trained, saving the project results in failure. Project file is corrupted, cannot be loaded again.

The problem is related to a change in pandas 0.25, see https://github.com/ilastik/ilastik-conda-recipes/issues/77

Right now this is mitigated by pinning pandas to 0.24.x, however, this will bubble up again

## Expected behavior
This should work!

## To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Within the Multicut workflow
1. Add some 2d/3d along with a probability map
2. Do preprocessing
3. Click one edge and do _live predict_
4. CTRL-s (or save) -> :boom:

## Error message/traceback

If applicable, please add tracebacks with formatting, such as

```pytb

title: inner dataset path selection leaked outside projects
body:
## Describe the bug
When a file hierarchical file (e.g. h5) is added, that contains multiple paths, the first time it is added, one is asked to select an inner dataset. When one opens a new project afterwards and adds the same dataset, one has to go to dataset properties to choose a different path. I do see that this could be regarded as a feature if one has a file, where e.g. all dataset present different layers. In reality, however, datasets might be split over channels, time, z, and users might choose to work on them individually. It might then become a nuisance to always have to go to the dataset properties to change it (which is not obvious, too).

## Expected behavior
Default inner paths should not leak between projects. If I open a new project, the inner path should be left blank and should be choosen. If I add another hierarchical dataset with a similar dataset to the same project, I guess, it should be fine to add the same inner path as a default one. but _not_ across project boundaries.

Specifically the code relating to `def _add_default_inner_path(self, roleIndex: int, inner_path: str):` (and all the other default file handling needs to be changed accordingly).

I feel like https://github.com/ilastik/volumina/pull/257 was very much inspired to circumvent this leaking in tests.

title: hdf5 table export from object classification does not contain table header
body:
## Describe the bug
The `.h5` table export is currently of limited use - the header is missing. Meaning of the numbers in the table has to be guessed (can't be done ;))

## Expected behavior
The `/table` path in the `.h5` file should contain table headers as an attribute

## To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Within the Object Classification Workflow
1. Add some [2d/3d/4d/5d] raw data and corresponding segmentation or prediction map in the data selection applet
2. If with prediction map: Go to the thresholding applet and do thresholding
3. Select some features in the object feature selection applet
4. Train a classifier in the object classification applet
5. export a h5 table in the object information export applet (select all features to get a more confusing table without headings ;))

title: Loading Projects with .h5 files as input data currently broken
body:
<!---
Thank you for letting us know that there is a problem in ilastik.
Filling out this template as detailed as possible will help us to improve the software.
--->


## Describe the bug
We seem to have caught a bug with recent changes. When you save a project with the current code-base, it cannot be opened, when one of the input images is an h5 file. Projects stored with older versions (`<= 1.3.3b2`) work.

## Expected behavior
Saving a project should enable opening it later ;)

## To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Within the any workflow
1. Add some [2d/3d/4d/5d] `.h5` data in the data selection applet
2. Save the project

title: Pixel Classification: live update not synchronized among lanes
body:
<!---
Thank you for letting us know that there is a problem in ilastik.
Filling out this template as detailed as possible will help us to improve the software.
--->


## Describe the bug
In pixel classification, when working with multiple images, _live update_ used to be synchronized along lanes. Right now the lanes behave weird and independently. One can also arrive at inconsistent states where _live update_ appears to be pressed but one can still go back to feature selection (see screenshot)

## Expected behavior
Pressing _live update_ in __any__ lane should update it globally.

## To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Within the Pixel Classification workflow
1. Add multiple images
2. Select some features in the _Feature Selection Applet_
3. In training, do some annotations, click _live update_ mode
4. Switch a lane, see that _live update_ is disabled


## Screenshots
![blah](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24434157/63952785-74759b80-ca80-11e9-9575-eba7498e8bf3.png)


## Desktop (please complete the following information):
 - ilastik version: this problem was introduced in `1.3.3b2`

the cause is most likely somewhere in these two commits:
* 52bd155bc7524d2a7dd3378388db44d896a1f7bd
* f2539169463212a45f59f75bfde0e5d2757b20bf

 
 <!---
For developers only:
in order to reproduce the environment properly it is of great help to know the exact commits for each of the main packages.

for d in ilastik lazyflow volumina; do
    (cd $d && echo "$d ilastik/$d@$(git rev-parse --verify HEAD)")
done

Just run the the preceding for loop in your shell from your ilastik-meta folder and paste the output below, after the comment mark.
Example output:

ilastik ilastik/ilastik@b060889258b8e8e5a8291d1c391dcfeb80474131
lazyflow ilastik/lazyflow@f1eaa478381ca27cf1ee43e4a26c96175a914073
volumina ilastik/volumina@0431fcefd75ecba2ddc3fe1fe86b47f65132f76b
--->

title: White/Transparent pixels in prediction (3rd class with 2 defined classes)
body:
## Describe the bug

Using the release version `1.3.2post1-win64.exe` on Win 10:

 With only two classes defined (label colors yellow/green), the segmentation output 
shows a few white (or transparent) pixels. When I turn on the visibility for the "raw image"
the pixel values of the raw image show through at these locations.  Possibly this is related to https://github.com/ilastik/ilastik/issues/72 ?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2210044/58059594-04b66180-7bb1-11e9-9803-be66b00e9cac.png)



## Expected behavior
* Each pixel belongs to one of the two defined classes
* raw image data not visible at any pixel location if segmentation view is enabled

## To Reproduce
Just labelled a volume with 2 classes

title: Can't change axis meaning in shared dataset properties
body:
## Describtion
Changing the axes of multiple datasets at once fails.

## Expected behavior
Changing all datasets axis at once should work fine (Maybe with a warning about invalidating the trained classifier).

## To Reproduce
1. Load more than one 3 dimensional dataset.
2. Mark all datasets in the data seleciton applet.
3. right click the marked datasets and click 'edit shared properties'
4. Edit Axes...

## Error message/traceback
Strangely no error messages (even with --debug)

## Screenshots
![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15139589/53413094-65c40400-39cb-11e9-874c-1206e240e3c4.png)

- volumina ilastik/volumina@c500bc07f9dde45aad2d54464738e5af1cbfa776

title: Data Conversion: Fails if axes are reinterpreted (in data selection)
body:
<!---
Thank you for letting us know that there is a problem in ilastik.
Filling out this template as detailed as possible will help us to improve the software.
--->


## Describe the bug
When data is loaded into ilastik where axes need to be reinterpreted, export will fail with the error shown below.

## Expected behavior
Export should work

## To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Within the _data conversion_ workflow
1. Add some 3d data in the _data selection_ applet
2. Right click on the data set and reinterpret the axes (for me axes were `tyxc`, which I changed to `zyxc`.
3. In the _export applet_ you can go with the default settings and just hit export -> error

## Error message/traceback
```pytb

title: MultiCut: Error on showing debug layers in Watershed
body:
After debug layers where activated and Watershed was updated, when trying to make each debug layer visible the following error occurs:

title: NN classification workflow does not save labels
body: Labels are not serialized

title: Start Tiktorch Server
body:
- [x] start server remotely with fixed configiguration of address and port
- [x] expose address/port config to user (new applet before the NN Training applet)
- [x] connected gui input to tiktorchclassifier factory

title: Object Classification: ilastik tries to paint in pixel labels, causes error
body:
(Sorry, I must have pressed Ctrl+Enter or Shift+Enter or something like that, so the issue was submitted before I wrote the description)

I try to use the ObjectClassification workflow (with segmentation) on a bunch of 3d h5 volumes. I randomly seem to get an error when I try to label objects:

```
ERROR 2018-12-20 12:01:41,953 excepthooks 65377 140088163800896 Unhandled exception in thread: 'MainThread'
ERROR 2018-12-20 12:01:41,953 excepthooks 65377 140088163800896 Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/g/kreshuk/snajder/ilastik-1.3.2rc1-Linux/ilastik-meta/volumina/volumina/brushingcontroller.py", line 296, in _writeIntoSink
    self._dataSink.put(slicing, labels.reshape(tuple(newshape)))
  File "/g/kreshuk/snajder/ilastik-1.3.2rc1-Linux/ilastik-meta/volumina/volumina/pixelpipeline/datasources.py", line 361, in put
    transposedArray = taggedArray.withAxes(*inputKeys)
  File "/g/kreshuk/snajder/ilastik-1.3.2rc1-Linux/lib/python3.6/site-packages/vigra/arraytypes.py", line 1120, in withAxes
    raise RuntimeError("VigraArray.withAxes(): cannot drop non-singleton axis '%s'." % self.axistags[k].key)
RuntimeError: VigraArray.withAxes(): cannot drop non-singleton axis 'x'.

```

This is on ilastik 1.3.2-rc1 on Centos7.

It seems to appear randomly for some volumes, but:

* If it doesn't appear the first time I try to draw labels on that volume, it won't appear at all (for that volume)
* If it does appear for that volume, it will keep appearing and I am unable to label that volume all together
* saving the project and reloading sometimes helps - then I am sometimes even able to label the volume that was problematic before

title: Headless PixelClassification produces BusError when more than ~30 images should be processed
body:
I trained a pixel classification project on a single 2D tif image with one channel. 
If I predict in headless mode from the command line it works fine for a small number of images, but when I input 50 images it immediately crashes with a bus error

```
[1]    44324 bus error  /Users/chaubold/Applications/ilastik-1.3.2rc2-OSX.app/Contents/MacOS/ilastik
```

I once saw when processing 33 images that it did finish processing, but at the end crashed with a bus error as well. Ran with the 1.3.2rc binary on MacOS Mojave.

title: Suggest Features makes ilastik crash on mac if connected to projector
body: might be related to high/low dpi...

title: ExportApplet: Output Image Description not updated/correct
body:
_edit: rename to act as a summary issue for problems related to the output image description display_

In the `ExportApplet`, the output of the image description is not updated. This is very confusing. Also the output is not correct in the first place:

**Not working**
* Number of output channels is not reflected
* Coutout Subregion is not reflected
* Transposed axes are not reflected

**working**
* Data type is updated correctly

_from #1915:_
> In Pixel Classification and Autocontext (probably other workflows too) I noticed that the output "Shape" in the Output Image Description is always displayed as (depth, height, width, 1), for example "(181,512,512,1)".
>
>When exporting probabilities, though, the last dimension should be the number of labels. If I trained pixel classification to distinguish 3 labels, then the output is of shape (181,512,512,3), the dialog however still tells me that it will be (181,512,512,1).
>
>Expected behavior: Either the Image Export Options dialog should know which "Source" (Probabilities, Segmentation, Uncertainty,...) I previously selected and display the shape accordingly, or it should display something generic like (181,512,512,output_channels).

_original issue description:_
>In the new version of Ilastik (1.3.2), when using the pixel classification workflow, I am attempting to change the axis order at export (from zxyc to xyzc). When I click on "Transpose to Axis Order," the preview Output image description does not update. Please advise. 
>
>Thanks.

title: '>' not supported between instances of 'NoneType' and 'float'
body:
Hi,

I have this reproducible error message. What I did is:

* I started a multicut workflow, loaded raw files, probabilities, and ground truth
* Saved the project and closed ilastik
* Re-opened the project
* Update Watershed
* Auto-Label
* Live Multicut

Then I get this error message:

```
ERROR 2018-09-17 14:07:10,123 excepthooks 32212 140208585692928 Unhandled exception in thread: 'Worker #2'
ERROR 2018-09-17 14:07:10,141 excepthooks 32212 140208585692928 Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/g/kreshuk/snajder/ilastik-1.3.0-Linux/ilastik-meta/lazyflow/lazyflow/request/request.py", line 324, in _execute
    self._result = self.fn()
  File "/g/kreshuk/snajder/ilastik-1.3.0-Linux/ilastik-meta/ilastik/ilastik/applets/multicut/multicutGui.py", line 225, in _impl
    edge_disagreements = op.EdgeLabelDisagreementDict.value
  File "/g/kreshuk/snajder/ilastik-1.3.0-Linux/ilastik-meta/lazyflow/lazyflow/slot.py", line 1105, in value
    temp = self[:].wait()
  File "/g/kreshuk/snajder/ilastik-1.3.0-Linux/ilastik-meta/lazyflow/lazyflow/request/request.py", line 500, in wait
    return self._wait(timeout)
  File "/g/kreshuk/snajder/ilastik-1.3.0-Linux/ilastik-meta/lazyflow/lazyflow/request/request.py", line 526, in _wait
    self._wait_within_request( current_request )
  File "/g/kreshuk/snajder/ilastik-1.3.0-Linux/ilastik-meta/lazyflow/lazyflow/request/request.py", line 651, in _wait_within_request
    raise_with_traceback(exc_value, exc_tb)
  File "/g/kreshuk/snajder/ilastik-1.3.0-Linux/lib/python3.6/site-packages/future/utils/__init__.py", line 419, in raise_with_traceback
    raise exc.with_traceback(traceback)
  File "/g/kreshuk/snajder/ilastik-1.3.0-Linux/ilastik-meta/lazyflow/lazyflow/request/request.py", line 324, in _execute
    self._result = self.fn()
  File "/g/kreshuk/snajder/ilastik-1.3.0-Linux/ilastik-meta/lazyflow/lazyflow/slot.py", line 884, in __call__
    result_op = self.operator.execute(self.slot, (), self.roi, destination)
  File "/g/kreshuk/snajder/ilastik-1.3.0-Linux/ilastik-meta/ilastik/ilastik/applets/multicut/opMulticut.py", line 228, in execute
    edge_labels_from_probabilities = edge_probabilities > 0.5
TypeError: '>' not supported between instances of 'NoneType' and 'float'
```

I don't know whether it is specific to my file, as I haven't tried to reproduce it from the beginning. But if I repeat the steps after re-opening the file, I can reproduce it.

title: Running pixel classification in headless mode requires the old dataset
body:
When running pixel classification in a headless mode on new data, `dataSelectionSerializer` throws an error if the old dataset is not present:
```
File "/home/adrian/opt/ilastik-1.3.0-Linux/ilastik-meta/ilastik/ilastik/applets/dataSelection/dataSelectionSerializer.py", line 436, in _readDatasetInfo
    raise RuntimeError("Could not find data at " + filePath)
RuntimeError: Could not find data at MuviSPIM/2017-08-02_17.49.34_stPVB003-2-2xDR5v2_F3_nb25_Marvelous_fused_cropped_for_Arivis_InViewR_export_stacked.h5
```
Even when faking the old dataset, we still get the issue from the label serializer if the size of the fake data is different from the original old dataset:

title: Error using pixel classification with 2D h5 files
body:
### Observed behavior

If a 2D `h5` file is loaded into Pixelclassification, the following exception is thrown when adding a label:

```
ERROR 2018-04-26 11:48:12,897 excepthooks 19657 139812857657088 Traceback (most recent call last):
  File ".../ilastik-meta/ilastik/ilastik/applets/dataExport/dataExportGui.py", line 344, in handleTableSelectionChange
    self.showSelectedDataset()
  File ".../ilastik-meta/ilastik/ilastik/applets/dataExport/dataExportGui.py", line 516, in showSelectedDataset
    layerViewer = self.createLayerViewer(opLane)
  File ".../ilastik-meta/ilastik/ilastik/applets/pixelClassification/pixelClassificationDataExportGui.py", line 40, in createLayerViewer
    return PixelClassificationResultsViewer(self.parentApplet, opLane)
  File ".../ilastik-meta/ilastik/ilastik/applets/layerViewer/layerViewerGui.py", line 72, in __call__
    instance._after_init()
  File ".../ilastik-meta/ilastik/ilastik/applets/layerViewer/layerViewerGui.py", line 192, in _after_init
    self.updateAllLayers()
  File ".../ilastik-meta/ilastik/ilastik/utility/gui/threadRouter.py", line 76, in routed
    val = func(*args, **kwargs)
  File ".../ilastik-meta/ilastik/ilastik/applets/layerViewer/layerViewerGui.py", line 427, in updateAllLayers
    newGuiLayers = self.setupLayers()
  File ".../ilastik-meta/ilastik/ilastik/applets/pixelClassification/pixelClassificationDataExportGui.py", line 70, in setupLayers
    previewLayers = self._initPredictionLayers(opLane.ImageToExport)
  File ".../ilastik-meta/ilastik/ilastik/applets/pixelClassification/pixelClassificationDataExportGui.py", line 164, in _initPredictionLayers
    num_channels = predictionSlot.meta.getTaggedShape()['c']
KeyError: 'c'
```

### Expected behaviour

There is no reason why this shouldn't work as with other data. Maybe a channel has to be added to the shape

### Steps to reproduce

1. Open a new PixelClassification project
1. Load a 2D `.h5` file
1. go to Training
1. add a label

### Context

* **OS**: should be an issue in all, tested on Linux
* **Workflows**: tested in PixelClassification
* **Ilastik Version**: 1.3.1
* **Data**: `.h5` 2D file (so `len(shape)=2`)


You can generate suitable data with:
```Python
import h5py
import numpy

data = numpy.random.randint(0, 256, (1000, 500), dtype=numpy.uint8)
with h5py.File('/tmp/random2d.h5', 'w') as f:
    f.add_dataset('random', data=data)
```

Todo:

- [ ] check if this is still an issue after @FynnBe's wonderful PRs...

title: Variable importance is broken
body: Both the "Suggest Features" button and the menu option.

title: Remove obsolete 'encode_from_qstring' and 'decode_to_qstring' functions
body: Invocation of `decode_to_qstring` was causing errors in the DataSelectionApplet, since it doesn't exist. Those two functions are obsolete anyways since we're on Python 3

title: Object classification: part of the table not exported
body: "User label" and "predicted label" columns are missing.

title: File paths containing Korean characters do not work
body:
A Korean user just experienced problems on windows with the 1.3.0b3 binary when saving or loading files from paths that contain Korean characters. Our string handling should be fully unicode now, but maybe there's something off with the file path handling?

This could also affect other operating systems.

title: --table_filename flag raises exception when exporting h5
body:
I'm running a headless object classification project and trying to export the feature table. We need the h5 feature table because it includes the separated object images inside it, so csv is not an option. 

If I configure the feature table to export as csv it works fine even in headless mode. 

But when it's configured to export as h5, although it works fine in the gui, running the project headless gives the following error:

`Exception: (Exception("Developer error: When ilastik is running in headless mode, you aren't allowed to import PyQt4.",), <built-in function _unpickle_enum>, ('PyQt4.QtCore', 'CheckState', 0))`

title: conservation tracking does not load a saved project if tracking has not been run
body: breaks load of conservation tracking and learning projects

title: "--export_object_probability_img" flag doesn't seem to do anything
body:
I'm following the instructions [here](http://ilastik.org/documentation/basics/headless#tocAnchor-1-1-3) for headless operation of an object classification workflow. The command I'm using is:

`bash ~/dev/ilastik-1.2.2-Linux/run_ilastik.sh \
--headless \
--project=./ilastik-storage/projects/hematoxylin-dab-main/segmentation.ilp \
--export_object_probability_img \
--output_format=tif \
--output_filename_format=./ilastik-storage/out/{nickname}_out.tif \
--raw_data ./ilastik-storage/in/$1 \
--prediction_maps ./ilastik-storage/out/$PROB`

According to the documentation this should export a probability image for the object classes, but instead it outputs a _prediction_ image. It does this whether I include the flag or not. I can export a probability image from this project just fine through the GUI.

I notice that the documentation is for 1.1.3- does this flag still work the way it used to? If not, is there a new way to do this? I wasn't able to find any more info about it online.

title: Deleting Label raises error about ListModel, but continues
body:
When one has created some labels in Object Classification (or the object count classifier in tracking), and removes the last label by clicking the red cross button, ilastik pops up this nice error message:

![screen shot 2017-08-31 at 13 21 23](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16854/29920798-864a1350-8e4f-11e7-9421-d1317b6f0946.png)

Fun fact: the log file does not contain any more information than this message box shows.
ilastik continues without any noticeable problems, the label also disappears from the GUI.

Is there maybe something that changed in Qt5's list view?

title: Counting: Box resizing and moving dodgy
body:
When resizing a box in counting it happens occasionally that it resizes itself to almost 0 in vertical direction.
Also when dragging the box to a different position, it often jumps to the image boarder (outside of the current view).

Tested with 1.2.2 and python3 master on linux

title: Qt5 detects deadlock in GuiProgressBar
body:
Using `python=3.6` and `Qt5`, running the `qt5py3` branch, it seems that Qt has become more intelligent and notices some invalid connection of signals in the Tracking GuiProgressBar, and exits with the message below when one clicks on the `Track` button:

```
Qt: Dead lock detected while activating a BlockingQueuedConnection: Sender is TrackProgress(0x7fd905f3ee40), receiver is PyQtSlotProxy(0x7fd9071db840)
```

For now (see https://github.com/ilastik/ilastik/commit/d35f08a54b41d171d4ec85106363664b00756360) I made the *ConservationTrackingWorkflow* fall back to the `CommandLineProgressBarVisitor`, but we should figure out what is going on there.

title: Many old project files are not openable
body: To fix this we need a converter, which at least conserves user annotations.

title: Axes reordering: going from t to spatial dimension disables scrolling
body: When you loaded a 3D dataset and used one axis as time `t`, but then decide to switch it to a spatial interpretation, _e.g._ `z`, the corresponding slicing view in which one would scroll over that axis doesn't allow scrolling along that axis at all.

title: We try to compute 2D convex hull and skeleton features for 3D
body:
I guess during fixing #1188 in #1247, we overlooked that this does not work for 3D data.
Both object classification applets in tracking complain because they cannot compute the features, making tracking unusable for 3D at the moment.

title: Structured Learning Tracking: retraining a classifier removes tracking annotations
body:
While presenting the structured learning workflow today I went back to the division classifier and object count classifiers, added the "2 objects" class to the latter, added labels and retrained both. Then I went to go to the "Tracking -SL" applet again and tried to compute weights, and only when the results looked weird (negative transition weight) I noticed that the training annotations were completely gone.

The annotations should persist unless one changes the threshold/segmentation, and then it should warn about the annotation invalidation (probably already does, because that also invalidates the labels for the classifiers).

title: Conservation Tracking results are not identical
body:
I have compared the results from conservation tracking(CT) from  (#1186) with the current binary  (ilastik 1.1.9). The results are not identical.

On the drosophila dataset CT produces 2025 appearances ( the binary produced 90) and  2238 disappearances (the binary produced 303) with all parameters being equal. All other evaluation measures (number of divisions and moves) are approximately equal.

I suspect that the dis/appearance cost parameters are treated differently in both versions during graph construction.

title: Random Forest only uses Standard Features even though other categories are selected
body:
When training an Object Count Classifier in any automated tracking workflow we can now select the _2D Convex Hull_ and _2D Skeleton_ features, and they get serialized as "selected features" of the Random Forest in the project file, but apparently the feature vectors that the RF is trained with never sees these features.

See below for an example project file: The random forest was trained with feature vectors of length 1 for each sample, which is exactly the only standard object feature "Count", even though plenty of 2D shape features are selected.

However, this does not happen in a plain Object Classification project! 

![screen shot 2016-04-02 at 09 36 44](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16854/14226675/759cbc4a-f8b6-11e5-9e7c-fe79277603fc.png)

title: (Animal?) Tracking - Size Filtering breaks setLabel2color method
body:
If one uses a binary segmentation mask or does not apply a size-filter in thresholding, there is another size filter option in Tracking to get rid of very small or large objects so that they do not confuse the tracking algorithm. It looks like there is a bug in the setLabel2color method, which I guess could be due to a missing mapping of the indices between `pgmlink` and ilastik.

I only encountered in the animal tracking workflow right now, but will investigate whether this also applies to Conservation Tracking.

title: Windows binary needs updated version of numpy
body:
The Mac/Linux binaries include numpy 1.9, but the Windows binary includes an older version. (I forgot to request a new version of numpy when Ulli generated the new Windows binary.)

Apparently there is at least [one place](https://github.com/ilastik/ilastik/blob/842605f941a64685b084120203871150e1f600f6/ilastik/applets/labeling/labelingImport.py#L134) in ilastik where we rely on a [new feature in v1.9](http://docs.scipy.org/doc/numpy/reference/generated/numpy.unique.html) (`return_counts`), so the Windows binary needs to be updated.

title: Crash in OpColorizeLabels due to shared file location
body:
@willgray encountered an error (see below) when using the headless ObjectClassification workflow in a cluster environment.  It was probably caused by two processes attempting to write to `~/.lazyflow/random_color_table.npy` simultaneously.

Initial thoughts:
- If necessary, we could use a `FileLock` to prevent this from happening.
- There's no reason the random color table should be necessary at all in headless mode.  Instead of generating the table during graph initialization, it could be generated during `execute()`.
- There's got to be a better way to generate random colors than this -- is a file really necessary?

title: Tracking: Max number of objects per Merger wrong after loading a project from disk
body:
Regarding the Automated Tracking Workflow:

In the tracking applet, the _Max number of Objects per Merger_ spin box should always be in sync with the highest label in _Object Count Classification_ unless the user manually intervened, and on project load it should be at least set to a value that allows to run tracking and not show an error message.

This relates to the slightly unintuitive behaviour that _tracking parameters are only saved if they have been used in a run of tracking (aka a click on `Track!`)._

title: MessageServer contains cycle and __del__()
body:
If a class implements the Python `__del__` method, we must be careful to [never](https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__del__) include it in any object cycles:

> Circular references which are garbage are detected when the option cycle detector is enabled (it’s on by default), but can only be cleaned up if there are no Python-level **del**() methods involved.

The `MessageServer` class violates this rule.  For example:
- `parent` points to `self` points to `parent`
- `parent` points to `self` points to `self.server` points to `parent`.)

Somehow this needs to be fixed, or the MessageServer will never be garbage collected.

title: Assigning no Labels for a class during labeling results in its obliteration
body:
To reproduce the problem:
1. Create a new PixelClassification project with three label-classes (named 'Label 1' [red], 'Label 2' [green] and 'Label 3' [yellow])
2. Assign labels only for class 'Label 2' and 'Label 3'. After pressing `Live update` we obtain a segmentation only containing _green_ and _yellow_ regions.
3. Save the project and close ilastik.
4. Load the project. All three labels are still present. However, after pressing `Live update` we obtain a segmentation in _red_ and _green_! However, the labels are still shown in _green_ and _yellow_. Exporting the segmentation results in a file containing only 1 and 2 as values. Thus, the true class `Label 1`  disappeared and for the other classes `Label N` became `Label N-1`. 

(Assigning only `Label 1` and `Label 3` in step 2 results in deletion of the true class `Label 2` and `Label 3` becomes `Label 2` in the final output.)

title: IndexError in Batch Prediction input selection
body:
When deleting some of the already added inputs in Batch Prediction input selections, it throws an IndexError : list index out of range
![screenshot from 2014-09-25 11 28 32](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/871398/4402318/b2567ec6-4496-11e4-8c4c-298557c2d198.png)

title: Multi-labeling is off
body:
When I label pixel individually, no matter where the center of the cursor is on the pixel of interest, the labeling is correctly attributed to that pixel.
However, when I label several pixels at once (click-and-drag), it happens often that the labeling falls below or to the right of what I was aiming at.
Precisely, if I click below the center of a pixel or to its right, the labeling will be attributed to the neighboring one.
This is likely a rounding/ceiling or an indexing issue during the interpolation.

title: Double-click on "Add Label" causes problems
body:
Normally, if the user clicks the "Add Label" button, the shape of the prediction slot changes (the number of channels increases by 1).  GUIs such as the batch export applet notice that the slot metadata has changed, and they update themselves accordingly in `setupLayers()`.

But if the user adds two labels very quickly (i.e. by double-clicking the "Add Label" button), somehow the batch data export applet "misses" the second notification.  I have no idea why this is happening.

Steps to reproduce:
- New project, add data, select features
- In training, double-click the "add label" button
- Add a file to the BATCH input list.
- Open the BATCH export applet.  Notice that the number of prediction layers is not right.

title: Thresholding applet: sigma values not updated between lanes
body: For a project with multiple lanes, if the smoothing sigma values are changed in one, the widgets of other lanes are not updated. However, if they "Final output" layer was activated for these lanes, it is recomputed with the new sigmas. It is not obvious what is the right behavior here: should we or should we not allow for different parameter settings for different datasets? It can be useful, but then how do we define the parameters for batch processing? I'd rather not allow it and enforce the same parameter settings for all datasets.

title: Auto-copy multipage tiffs to the project file
body: At the moment we auto-copy tiff SEQUENCES (i.e. multiple files) to the project file for fast hdf5 access.  We don't auto-copy multipage tiff files, but they are really just as bad as a sequence for data access.

title: Loading datasets from an h5 file with multiple datasets is broken
body: If the h5-file contains dataset of different dimensions, the project is initialised to the dimensions of the first dataset. This makes it impossible to select a different dataset in the h5-file as there is a dimension-conflict.

title: Default channel display for 4-channel data should be "grayscale"
body: .... never "RGBA"

title: Pixel Classification: Features, too large for 3D, are not removed correctly
body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Load a 3D stack with only few z-slices.
2. In feature selection, select some small features, click ok
3. Now add one feature which is too big, it complains but is added
4. Do some pixel classification training and hit live update, you will get a "Feature computation error: your image is too small......."
5. Leave live update and go back to feature selection
6. Remove the big feature
7. Hit live update in Training mode -> the big feature is still there, it keeps complaining...

Saving the project file and reloading the project again seems to be a workaround but cannot be the solution. ;-)

title: After trying to load 4D data - error message pops up recursively and prevents the user from closing ilastik
body:
I tried to load the 4D drosophyla data from the example download page into a carving workflow. It complained about wrong axes, I shuffled the axes a bit but finally clicked "cancel". An error message "index out of bounds" kept popping up recursively, so quickly that I could not even close ilastic.

Log can be found here: https://gist.github.com/chaubold/b7cc4d80ddb8ea3efa58

title: Can't change axistags from 'xyz' to 'xyc' for multichannel 2D data set
body:
Try the following: Create multichannel 2D data set without axistags (as Kumar did using Matlab) and load into ilastik. The data set will be interpreted as 'xyz' by ilastik and it thus adds a singleton 'c' axis. If you now want to change the 'z' axis to 'c' (which is very likely, as you typically want the features to be computed per channel), ilastik complains that you can't change a 4D data set to 3D and doesn't let you change the axistags.

As multichannel 2D is a quite common usecase, there should be an option to change the 'z' axis to a 'c' axis inside ilastik after loading an HDF5 file.

title: "Open Recent Project" file name abbreviations are bad
body:
See screenshot below. This is actually two bugs:
- When there is enough space on the screen, full path and file names should be displayed, or at least a substantial part of them. Currently, they are abbreviated much more aggressively then necessary.
- The abbreviations themselves are often very bad, so that it is hard to guess the full path/file name. If at all possible, the file name should be kept intact, and only the path abbreviated.

I observed the problem on Windows and didn't check if it occurs on other platforms as well. Although it is just annoying, I marked it as 'showstopper' because it makes a very bad impression on the start screen.

![screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/897680/3472240/e20306e4-02c9-11e4-9111-55facec61919.png)

title: Export "Save File" window defaults to a strange directory
body:
On the Mac (and maybe other platforms), the default export directory for the "Save File" dialog in the export UI is poorly chosen.

Steps to reproduce:
- Create a new project
- Use the export applet and click "Choose Settings"
- Click the "Select" button to change the export location.  The "Save File" dialog will open to the "Resources" directory within the Mac .app bundle.

Note: Apparently Contents/Resources is the default cwd for bundles created with py2app.  That explains the strange directory choice.  Now we just need to change the default for that window.

title: Cursor gets stuck as the 'hand' when dragging slicing planes.
body: The cursor can get stuck as the 'hand' after dragging (or trying to drag) the positional plane lines in any of the views (the cursor changes to a hand when over the lines, but doesn't change back after dragging).

title: Changes in preprocessing remove seeds
body:
User report:

I encountered errors after changing the values on the Preprocessing tab
of the Carving workflow.  I had labeled and segmented two object
already, saved them and the entire project, then changed "dark lines
(inverted, smoothed)" to "dark lines (valley)" and the "filter scale"
value.  I had to uncheck "write protect".

I had expected that the original labels would be preserved, but the
exact segmentation lost (just need to recreate it).  I got the following
errors ("IndexError: index 266034 is out of bounds for size 259728")
when selecting the Labelling tab.

I was able to re-Segment the two objects and get rid of those errors.
(After saving the objects I was also able to save the project without
error).

Would it be possible to remove the computed values (segmentations)
dependent on the old Preprocessing values (but keep the labels) to
prevent the errors?

title: Crash when using Qt with debug symbols
body:
When loading a project in ilastik, the following assert fails and will therefore crash the program when the qt library is build with debug settings:
ASSERT: "visual != -1" in file itemviews/qheaderview.cpp, line 1184

This is due to the following lines:
`self.horizontalHeader().setResizeMode(DatasetDetailedInfoColumn.Nickname, QHeaderView.Interactive)
self.horizontalHeader().setResizeMode(DatasetDetailedInfoColumn.Location, QHeaderView.Interactive)
self.horizontalHeader().setResizeMode(DatasetDetailedInfoColumn.InternalID, QHeaderView.Interactive)
self.horizontalHeader().setResizeMode(DatasetDetailedInfoColumn.AxisOrder, QHeaderView.Interactive)`

in ilastik/applets/dataSelection/datasetDetailedInfoTableView.py

When removed, the error disappears, but it doesn't look as pretty.

Apparently this assert is optimized out in the Release build and therefore unlikely to be relevant to end users, but probably showcasing some racing condition problems.

title: Cannot change (or disable all) feature selection without raw data after changing from single 2D file to stack of 2D files
body:
Switching from a single 2D image input to a stack of 2D images as input with an additional spatial dimension is not possible if features have already been selected and ilastik needs to be restarted.

I do not know, if this is really a bug, because selecting features (and train) for a 2D image should not be followed by 3D analysis. However, ilastik should not become malfunctioning on user input (restart required).

This is how you get there:

Pixel Classification -> Input Data -> Add New -> Add seperate image(s) -> select single 2D image -> Feature Selection -> Select Features -> select all -> Input Data -> Remove previously added data -> Add New -> Add a single 3D/4D Volume from Stack -> select Files (stack of 2d images) and open -> Warning Message:

Choose smaller scales (sigma) or use a larger dataset.

title: serialization of sklearn regression trees from counting not compatible across versions
body:
scikit-learn versions shipped in the latest binaries for windows and osx/linux are different, 0.12.1 and 0.14.1 respectively. It seems that pickles created with these versions are not compatible. 

This makes the ilastik project files saved from the counting workflow highly non portable. Not only can they not be opened with older/newer ilastik builds, but sharing between windows and osx/linux builds is not possible either.

We should handle the serialization of the sklearn regression trees manually to workaround this problem.

Here are the error messages:

title: OpRelabelSegmentation: Explicitely check/define type for InputSlot Image
body:
For some strange reason, the following line sometimes causes an error for me, as img is of datatype numpy.float from time to time:

result[t-roi.start[0]] = tmap[img[t-roi.start[0]]]

So it would be beneficial to directly cast 'img' to numpy.uint, before using it as an index for the array tmap.

(e.g. result[t-roi.start[0]] = tmap[img[t-roi.start[0]].astype(numpy.uint)]?)

title: Current position display underneath volume editor is limited to 4 digits for each dimension -> should adapt automatically

If your dataset has 10,000 slices or more in any of its dimensions, the current position is displayed incorrectly in the widget underneath the volume editor, as it just stops at 9999 (see attached image).

![github_ilastik_only_4_digits_of_position](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/2794524/2002395/43051720-85f2-11e3-904f-a51373ee7325.png)

title: ObjectClassification enables live update even if some classes haven't been used yet
body:
If you add more than two classes in ObjectClassification applet and only put labels for class 1 and e.g. class 3, you are allowed to enable live update mode. The classification will now only take into account the two labeled classes.

The main problem with this is the shape of the output data: 
- the predictions are still the class number: in the example 1 or 3
- the array of probabilities only contains as many classes as there are different labels (in the example there would be only two probabilities)
- the label names are still "Class1", "Class 2", "Class 3", etc.

So either the unlabeled classes should be ignored completely (not only in probabilities output slot, but also in predictions and label names), taken into account completely (set probability to 0, NaN or whatever, but ensure that there are as many entries in probabilities output slot as there are labels/label names) or live update should just be disabled if not all classes are used yet.

title: ObjectClassification: remove label should make predictions/labels dirty
body:
Steps to reproduce (in Object Classification applet):
1. Add 3 labels
2. add training examples for all labels
3. live update
4. remove label 2
5. live update => The old predictions are shown (with all 3 labels).
6. add another training example
7. live update => New predictions are shown but with the colors of the original second label.

title: ObjectClassification applet requests all time frames of txy data at once without needing to
body: If live update mode is enabled in ObjectClassification applet, it pulls the features for all time frames of txy data at once, although only the features of the labeled and the currently viewed frames are needed.

title: Prefetching does something weird...
body:
1. If prefetching is enabled on a 2d+t dataset where we scroll through time, ONLY the top left tile is requested for the next time steps, i.e. [0:1, 0:255, 0:255, 0:1], [1:2, 0:255, 0:255, 0:1], [2:3, 0:255, 0:255, 0:1], etc. But not the other tiles of the Viewport.
2. The prefetching does not look into the cache but blindly calls execute, even if the tiles are displayed at the moment. For instance, zooming IN, should not call any execute at all, since everything is already displayed (which is the case when prefetching is disabled). But when we enable prefetching, the tiles (and those top left tiles in subsequent time steps) are requested anyway.

In total, using prefetching slows down the scrolling, since it ignores the cache and fetches only the top left tile.

title: Counting: change the data export and the batch processing to conform to new standard
Counting: re-sizing the box too fast cause a slot isn't ready error
Manual Tracking: Instead of only yellow objects, objects are colored by their connected component ct.
Parallelize feature computation during training.
body: A hackathon change had the accidental side effect of requesting training features in series instead of in parallel.  See `OpTrainRandomForestBlocked.execute()`.  This is probably only a big performance hit when the RF is trained for the first time (after that, the features are cached anyway).  Still, it should be fixed.

title: volumina: colortable layers do not work correctly with tables designed to show a transparent background
body: If a colortable is smaller than the number of labels in the image, volumina will use a modulo operation to look up the color. If the first entry of the colortable is transparent, this will result in some objects becoming invisible.

![screenshot_ilastik_icons_disappeared](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/2794524/936766/cb525c3e-00c1-11e3-8126-5c98378e8e98.png)

Steps to reproduce:
- create two labels
- compute prediction
- make the segmentations visible
- assign a part of the area of one labels segmentation to the other label
- compute the prediction  again

body: Try panning right and left on a large 2D image. Sometimes it just does not update the prediction. Adding a new label forces an update correctly.

title: normalization is performed even when disabled by the user
body:
In pixel classification, in the data selection applet: load a uint8 dataset. Verify that normalization is off. Scroll around the dataset. Requests to the raw data are done using normalization (in my case, `normalize=[21, 211]`, instead of `[0, 255]`). This can be seen by right clicking on the layer and then _Adjust thresholds_. Even though normalization is off the sliders are showing `[21, 211]`.

To see debug output, add the following to your logging.json configuration:

```
"volumina.pixelpipeline.imagesources.GrayscaleImageSource":  { "level": "INFO" },
"volumina.pixelpipeline.imagesources.GrayscaleImageRequest": { "level": "INFO" },
```

body:
In the _Object classification (from binary image)_ workflow, add both raw data and segmentation images. In my case, they lie in `/home/tkroeger/ilastik_tests/`. Then, 
save the project. This works. Now do _Save As_ in a different directory, for example `/home/tkroeger`. This produces the following error:

``` python
lazyflow.operators.ioOperators.opInputDataReader.DatasetReadError: Unable to open numpy dataset: /home/tkroeger/ilastik_tests/ilastik_tests/cube_objects_raw.npy
```

title: binary object classification workflow allows to select features when no binary image is specified
body:
Steps to reproduce
- Start object classification from binary
- Add `cube_objects_binary.npy` as the _raw data_
- Do _not_ add an label image
- Switch to the feature selection applet
- Click on select features

This yields the following error:

``` python
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/tkroeger/phd/src/ilastik/ilastik/applets/objectExtraction/objectExtractionGui.py", line 256, in _selectFeaturesButtonPressed
    labelshape = list(mainOperator.BinaryImage.meta.shape)
TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not iterable
```

title: Carving: "object not saved" info text disappears too early
body: The Carving Applet Drawer has a text "object not saved". After labeling and segmenting, it disappears immediately. However, it is supposed to disappear when the user has _saved_ the segmented object, not earlier.

title: Deleting labels in pixel classification needs two attempts
body: on the first try, it gives the label the color of the next label, but keeps it in the list. On the second try, it goes away as expected

title: Carving: Objects are not deleted when starting new preprocessing
body:
Steps to reproduce: 
- load image into Carving Workflow
- do preprocessing
- draw labels
- segment
- save object 
- return to preprocessing
- change parameters, rerun preprocessing
- try: save project / load object in carving

At this point, the carving-MST is new, the objects, which are stored in the graph object, don't exist anymore, but their references aren't deleted in the Carving Gui. This causes a couple of errors, e.g. saving fails when trying to save the object, the .ilp-file is corrupt afterwards and loading the object with the Object Manager causes a KeyError.

title: Labeling Gui: Clicking on second label causes error
body:
steps to reproduce:
- load image in Carving Workflow
- do Preprocessing
- switch to Labeling and click on "object" in the problem specific labels.

-> an IndexError occurs

note: this doesn't appear when first clicking on "background" and then on "object" afterwards.

title: Blockwise object classification multichannel support
body: Currently fails for images with more than 1 channel (i only tried 2D). We should either forbid it in an assert or support it. It looks like a problem with block/halo settings and would probably also fail for multi-time data.

title: Blockwise object classification pulls predictions too early
body: all safeguards against that are in the object classification gui. When the blockwise applet does it from code, objectTrain fails with an irrelevant error message.

title: Pixel classification deserealization problems
body:
If multiple images are loaded and labeled, but "full volume predict" is only done for a subset of them, deserialization of the project sometimes fails due to some assert. 

In general, should we have asserts in this part at all? I'd say it should try to load all it can and never fully fail. No one wants to lose all their labels because the list of feature names didn't get saved correctly.

title: pixel classification crashes when live update is started
body:
When pressing the live update button ilastik greys out and memory starts filling up. This happens for single pngs, stacks of pngs and hdf5 data.
This happens only on my laptop (Ubuntu 13.04).
The versions of the dependencies are checked.

title: volumina: Increase tile 'progress pie' timeout
body: The tile progress pies should not flicker for short tile renderings.

title: ilastik crash memory error in pixel classification
body:
Ilastik crashes when Live update is pressed  (Windows 7 64 bits).

To reproduce it,  I do the following:
1. Open Ilastik 06, create a new project, pixel classification
2. Load a jpg RGB image 
3. select few features
4. add two simple labels
5. Live update
6. starts to work, memory goes up to 12Gb (limit), freezes.
7. memory emptied, an empty message box is displayed

title: volumina: Channel selection spinbox allows out-of-range values
body:
If the user has a multi-channel layer, the layer widget uses a spinbox to give the user control over which channel is currently displayed.  If the shape of that layer changes such that the number of channels is reduced, the spinbox max should be reset according to the new shape.

For example, if a layer starts 10 channels, the spin box should have a max value of 9.  If the layer is re-shaped to have only 5 channels, the max spinbox value should be reduced to 4.  Currently, it allows the user to select values greater than 4, which raises an exception when the layer data is fetched.

title: In object classification applet not all slots of all lanes get serialized
body: Before we forget this issue again: if the prediction was not computed, nothing is saved in its place and the deserializing fails when trying to resize to less slots.

title: Object Classification: right-click on object sometimes shows the wrong object id
body:
To reproduce: Right-click on an arbitrary object, then move the cursor to another object, right-click again (to close the menu), then right-click again (to show the menu for the new object). It then shows the same object ID.

If closing the right-click menu by right-/left-click on background, it works as expected.

title: Vigra neighborhood features shouldn't be necessary
body: Currently if only global vigra features are selected, it still tries to call compute_local and fails there.

title: Show errors from feature computation
body: Currently if something fails in the feature computation, it just silently closes the little window with the progress bar. The exception should be shown to the user.

title: PixelClassification: When saving project, Batch Prediction Output Applet is activated
body: When saving a project with the training applet activated, the batch prediction output applet gets the focus after saving.

title: Multi input shows last dataset first after deserialization
body: The tracking workflow requires to specify a file for raw data (1. tab) and one for prediciton maps (2. tab). When a stored project is loaded, it first shows the prediction map dataset in the raw data tab. Only after switching to the prediction map tab and switching back to the raw data tab, the correct raw data set is displayed.

title: Input Data Applet: Add volume from stack doesn't handle time-lapse data correctly
body:
When a set of (multi-page) 3D tiff files is loaded as a stack to get a txyz dataset, the actual z dimension of the multi-page tiffs is ignored and the different time steps are stacked in z direction. So, from 3 files of 10^3, instead of a (3,10,10,10,1) dataset, a (10,10,3,1) dataset is loaded.

On the other hand, when 2D tiff files are loaded, they are interpreted as xyz data, the 2D datasets stacked in z direction. 

To solve these problems, the user should be able to specify during the "Add volume from stack" dialog whether to stack the files in z- or t- direction (or even both for the case of sliced multi-page tiffs - then the shape or #timesteps is needed as an input parameter). 

This is needed for the tracking workflows to allow users to use tif files besides of h5-files.

title: Volumina: Random black tiles
body:
Sometimes volumina shows single completely black tiles as shown here: http://s24.postimg.org/a8oe531t1/Screenshot_from_2013_06_07_18_17_35.png

If I record that correctly, it only happens when I load probability maps (from batch processing) as datasets (which is needed in tracking, for instance). 

I guest it is just a volumina bug since everything is computed with the correct values and the positions of the black tiles differ from applet to applet.

I have seen the same bug on Fred's windows installation.

title: TwoLevelThresholdingApplet: Problems with 2d+t data
body:
1. The Thresholded Labels Slot shows weird results with 2d+t data, see screenshot: http://s3.postimg.org/71v4wvhf7/Screenshot_from_2013_06_07_12_16_40.png
2. The "Output (Cached)" Layer shows results as expected, although it is very slow since it computes the thresholding for ALL time steps simultaneously. For big datasets, just looking at the result for the first image is very time consuming! Instead, the layer should only request the result for the currently displayed time step.

title: Labels are only considered when in first time slice
body:
If you have a time axis as well and put labels to different time slices but the first, you will run into different problems - two of these I have encountered yet:

1) You can only do the prediction (e.g. 'Live Update', ...), if there is more than one different label class in the first time slice. Otherwise, objectClassificationGui.checkEnableButtons() will disable these options.

2) If you save a project and load it again, all label classes which have no label instance in the first time slice will disappear from the labelling drawer on the left. You can reconstruct your old labels by just clicking 'Add Label' as often as needed - the label names and colors are saved in the project file, but not the count.

I guess these problems all come from the label counting 'policy'. Instead of counting the number of different labels only in the first time slice, it should be counted in the whole (t,x,y,z)-volume at once per default.

title: DataSelection: "Copy to Project File" doesn't work correctly if force5d=True
body:
For example, if a dataset that is xyzc on disk, it is written to the project file as txyzc, but the axistags stored in the project file for this dataset are still stored as xyzc.  The mismatch between axistags (len 4) and the new shape (len 5) eventually leads to exceptions.

To fix this, we should probably just copy the dataset to the project file in it's _original_ shape/order.

title: Batch applet: threading issues when adding a stack volume
body: When the users selects "Add Volume From Stack..." in the batch input data selection applet, strange things happen in the GUI.  This seems to be due to the fact that the UI callback handlers are run from the context of the stack loading thread (not the gui thread).

title: Batch Applet: Layer controls only apply to the first image in the list.
body: They should always operate on the currently visible results.

title: layer export dialog ROI range
body:
when there are 0, ..., n slices in a volume, the export dialog allows setting the max to n+1 (rather than n). Same for all spatial directions. 

It probably makes sense to use C-style indexing (0, ..., n rather than 1, ..., n+1) to be consistent with the coordinates shown in the orthoviews.

title: Can't draw labels in uppermost region of training applet due to some invisible bar

In training applet you can't draw labels in the uppermost region of the volume, i.e. between the swap/rotate/etc. icons. The cursor can still be moved there, but the crosshairs stop at some invisible bar and you can't draw labels underneath (which I just needed to do).

![label_at_top](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/2794524/350722/aaf5c2c0-a02a-11e2-8d61-8b57a6ddb83d.png)11

Workarounds:
1. Zoom in massively such that only one pixel is covered by the invisible bar -> quite impractical
2. Start drawing below the invisible bar and just draw the cursor up -> marks everything from below the invisible bar up to the thing you wanted to label -> now you can do the same trick with the eraser to remove the unwanted labeling ;-)

title: Saving object predictions triggers labeling and feature computation
body:
Saving an object classification project triggers labeling and feature computation, which for large projects may take a long time. The problem is caused by the prediction serializer: when it requests the predictions, it causes the whole pipeline to be executed. We need to enable prediction serialization only when the user requests it.

The right thing to do is probably to rewrite `SerialPredictionSlot` from `pixelClassificationSerializer.py` so that it works with both pixel and object predictions. Right now the object serializer is just using a `SerialDictSlot` for predictions.

title: Saving Project after Feature Selection disables Training applet
body: Training applet is then grayed out. (Saving the project a second time enables it again... :-) )

title: Input selection selecting multiple files not working correctly
body: Clicking on "Add File...", selecting multiple tifs (with CTRL) adds the tif selected at last multiple times instead of adding all of the selected tifs.

title: White tiles appear sometimes
body:
If the tile for the label layer appear before the raw data tile, then a white tile (with the brush stroke on it), will be rendered.

If this isn't the desired behaviour, how should we fix it?

title: Multi-Channel Support
body:
Currently ilastik and the pixel classification do not support multiple channels > 3.

use case: raw data with channels > 3 in the pixel classification workflow.

this problem also affects volumina: volumina does not support to display layers with a different number of channells - which would happen in this case, the prediction would only have 1 channel, while the raw data would have more channels.

title: ilastikShell.py gui test is broken
body: `python ilastik/ilastik/shell/gui/ilastikShell.py` was never ported to the new multi-lane applet API.

title: "Save Project As" does not work on windows whereas "Take Snapshot" does
body:
When using "Save Project As", an "Error Attempting Save" comes up which explains that one should use "Take Snapshot". However, the error was

```
The process cannot access the file because it is being used by another process
```

Reported by czhci.

title: Live button is not enabled correctly if features were selected after labels were created.
body:
Steps to reproduce:

1) New Project
2) Add input file
3) SKIP FEATURE SELECTION
4) Add 2 label classes; draw some labels
5) Select some features
6) "Live Update" button is disabled, and won't re-enable until a label class is deleted and re-drawn.

title: When loading 2D images, they appear as 3D images
body:
- When loading 2D images, they appear as 3D images [should be solved]
- The layer context menu has a view in 3D button, which shouldn't be there for 2D images [still open]

title: Carving: giving the same name as an existing objects overwrites
In live mode, on train/predict, dirty tiles show as background
body: When refining a classifier by adding more brush strokes, the dirty tiles are just not drawn, so that the background is visible. It would be much better to show the outdated data in this case because the current behaviour prevents the user from further labeling until the tiles have arrived.

title: Layer visibility->input data->adjust thresholds
body: In "Layer visibility->input data->adjust thresholds", the range of the slide bar is hard-set as 255, no matter what the data type is, e.g. 16bits.

title: handle 16-bit images
body:
Related to #126, #105

```
In "Layer visibility->input data->adjust thresholds",
the range of the slide bar is hard-set as 255,
no matter what the data type is, e.g. 16bits.
```

From issue #105:

```
Note to whoever implements this:
lazyflow's slot.meta.drange attribute
should be used for this feature when the layer is from lazyflow.
```

Ilastik 0.5:
In the figures shown below, both images show the same 16bit data of an EM tomogram slice, original data (top) and when loaded in Ilastik 0.5 (bottom), with image intensity range being [-1200,1300] and [26000, 35000], respectively. It seems that Ilastik did some normalization of the data to fill the data range (and maybe avoiding negative intensity values??). 
Here is the cmd output print: "Normalizing your data for display purpose only, assuming you have 16bit data."
![ori](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/3789738/243499/b2035ac4-8a49-11e2-9f07-253a2c6cda25.png)
![ilastik](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/3789738/243500/b83f2d96-8a49-11e2-81fd-3de715f1ed01.png)

Ilastik 0.6:
Starting from when the same slice is loaded, the image display showed different appearances, depending on which stage of the process, i.e., at "Input Data" tab, the image was shown as in the bottom figure shown above, while when moving to "Feature Selection", after the features were selected, the image was displayed properly as the top figure, but at the next step of "Training", when we need to label the image, it appeared again as in the bottom figure. So the labeling had to be done on the very low contrast displayed image.

title: in live mode, erasing all labels from one class leads to crash
body:
The crash happened when the "live" mode is on, and when all the labels from one of the label classes are removed, e.g. using the rubber.

```
AssertionError: ERROR: Operator <lazyflow.operators.classifierOperators.OpPredic
tRandomForest object at 0x0000000015125048> has failed to provide a result of co
rrect shape. result shape is (256L, 256L, 2L) vs (256L, 256L, 3L).  roi was Subr
egion: start '[768, 256, 0]' stop '[1024, 512, 3]'
ERROR: volumina tiling layer rendering worker thread caught an unhandled excepti
on:Traceback (most recent call last):
```

While when it is in "paused" mode, this problem does not seem to occur.
Note that, in Ilastik 0.6 windows version, the red "cross" icon to remove the whole label class disappears when the "live" mode is on. Maybe it could be modified as a disabled grey icon but still shown?

title: Ilastik (16bit) images display problem
body:
Related to #128, #105

Ilastik 0.5:
In the figures shown below, both images show the same 16bit data of an EM tomogram slice, original data (top) and when loaded in Ilastik 0.5 (bottom), with image intensity range being [-1200,1300] and [26000, 35000], respectively. It seems that Ilastik did some normalization of the data to fill the data range (and maybe avoiding negative intensity values??). 
Here is the cmd output print: "Normalizing your data for display purpose only, assuming you have 16bit data."

![ori](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/3789738/243480/fd557922-8a48-11e2-8f24-4d7bb899b616.png)
![ilastik](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/3789738/243481/01ec5064-8a49-11e2-8abd-8e921bbfc25e.png)

Ilastik 0.6:
Starting from when the same slice is loaded, the image display showed different appearances, depending on which stage of the process, i.e., at "Input Data" tab, the image was shown as in the bottom figure shown above, while when moving to "Feature Selection", after the features were selected, the image was displayed properly as the top figure, but at the next step of "Training", when we need to label the image, it appeared again as in the bottom figure. So the labelling had to be done on the very low contrast displayed image.

body:
error when asserting data to operator

error due to recent changes in graph.py i guess.

last commits where it was working:
b12e2d7 ilastik
9b87e84 lazyflow

title: Classifier uses old labels when deleted
body:
I'm not sure if this is a bug, but I noticed the following behavior:
1. Create Labels
2. Give some brush strokes for each label
3. Go to live mode
4. Pause live mode
5. Delete the brush strokes added in 2
6. Go to live mode

=> The old classifier / segmentation is used.

title: Not providing labels for all classes leads to crash
body:
Related to #127.

Add three classes but only labels for two and predict.
I got a shape mismatch as follows:
AssertionError:  ERROR: Operator <lazyflow.operators.classifierOperators.OpPredictRandomForest object at 0x444e490> has failed to provide a result of correct shape. result shape is (1, 256, 256, 1, 2) vs (1, 256, 256, 1, 3).  roi was "Subregion: start '[0, 256, 512, 23, 0]' stop '[1, 512, 768, 24, 3]'"

The random forest returned two channels but ilastik expected three.

title: Reloaded project flips data shape
body: Make a new project. Load data from hdf5 and save project. After opening that project again the dataset is flipped by 90 degrees.

title: Group visibility selection: unexpected behaviour
body: Mark the checkboxes for both "Probability" and "Segmentation" group visibility. Unchecking "Probability" also unchecks "Segmentation". (Unchecking "Segmentation" keeps "Probability" checked as expected.)

title: Tracking: Slice selector in image view HUD not responding
body: The slice selector in the X-Y view is not responding to clicks, i.e. slice up/down and entering slice numbers directly doesn't work. It works in the other two views, though.

title: Relative path problem on Windows
body:
Windows doesn't allow relative paths accross drives. Therefore, the code at
ilastik\utility\pathHelpers.py", line 96:

``` python
    relPath = os.path.relpath(absPath, workingDirectory) 
```

fails when `absPath` and `workingDirectory` are on different drives. More instances of the same problem may linger around.

title: Keyboard shortcuts broken
body:
The recent API refactoring broke applet keyboard shortcuts:
- Each applet GUI is now instantiated once for every image the user has loaded.  When more than one image is loaded, the different instances instantiate conflicting shortcuts.
- For unknown reasons, the shortcuts for widgets in the viewer controls section (e.g. layer toggling) don't always work, depending on which frame currently has focus (even if only one image is loaded in the workflow).

title: Multi-page tiff files are not supported
body:
When selecting Input data -> Import Stack Files it lists .tiff as a supported file extension, but when I select a multi-page tiff stack ilastik tries to load it as a HDF5 file.

Either the supported file extension list should be changed or (ideally) multi-page tiff suport be added.

title: Threshold for Input Data is in the range [0,255] for 16bit uint in pixelClassificationWorkflow
body:
Related to #128, #126

The threshold option for the input data in the pixelclassification workflow does not adjust to 16bit uint data. The range is the same as for 8bit.

title: Relative path to dataset is not updated when choosing "Save Project As..."
body: When I save a previously saved project with "Save as..." in a different folder, the filepath variable in the ilp-file is not updated.

title: division by zero when saving new project
body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Open new project
2. Add data, select features, etc.
3. Save.
4. Start new project
5. Save.
