title: Label strokes persist after deleting labels
body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. create a label
2. paint a stroke
3. save project
4. delete label
5. create label
6. save project
7. load project

After loading, the strokes are present again.

title: Clicking "full volume predict" twice makes predictions disappear
body:
This happens during pixel classification.

The problem appears to be caused by this line in the pixelClassificationGui:

```
self.pipeline.FreezePredictions.setValue(predictionsFrozen)
```

When this line is commented out, everything appears to work.
### Steps to reproduce
1. Select features, label, etc.
2. Click 'predict full volume and save'
3. Verify that predictions are visible.
4. Click 'predict full volume and save' again.
5. Predictions are no longer visible.

title: Selecting "Save Project" trains classifier.
body:
Also see #151.

Selecting "Save Project" always saves the classifier.  If the classifier isn't trained yet, this triggers it to be trained first.  If the user just wanted to quickly save his labels and quit the program, the delay due to training is annoying.

Correct "Save Project" behavior:
- If the classifier isn't "dirty" with respect to current labels, save it.
- If the classifier is dirty, make sure it isn't saved (and delete any previously saved classifier from the project)

title: Carving shortcuts should use ShortcutManager.
body: ....otherwise they can't be set by the user and conflicts with other shortcuts won't be detected.

title: Labels names should be saved to the project file
body: Right now, the user can change the names of his label classes from "Label 1", "Label 2" etc, but the changes aren't saved to the project file.  When the project is re-opened, the names are reset.

title: Slicing Views should show old data (not white tiles) while pie-charts are shown.
Travis-CI tests aren't working
body: For some reason, the ilastik GUI tests are failing in the Travis-CI environment.

title: Strange scrolling bug in labeling applet drawer
body: The labeling drawer GUI has a strange bug that causes the applet drawer controls not to scroll with the rest of the applet bar.  This affects Mac OS X at least.

title: PixelClassification Training: Forgets parts of a brush stroke
body: In the Pixel Classification Training Applet, when I start to label with one brush stroke, this stroke is (partly) forgotten as soon as the label is rendered. This seems to happen only for the first stroke(s) of each label.

title: Time Spinbox increases by 2 when clicked
body:
To reproduce:
1. New Project, add 5d data from hdf5
2. Go to training drawer and click on the upper triangle of the timespinbox
-> Jumps from zero to 2

This is not happening when the ImageView is maximized.

Bug appears with the following commit to volumina
3fe2832d2130703f462ef0268160b3a3d400eefc

The bug appears only in pixelclassification, but not in standalone volumina.

The commit looks unrelated, though. Could be a bug somehow caused by the new tooltip or shortcut mechanism

title: DataSelection: Show error message when opening invalid file
body: When selecting a file with invalid datatype the "open file" silently closes and nothing happens. Show an error message to give the user feedback.

body:

- select all features at scale 11. 
- ok

title: Training applet: problems when loading differently-sized volumes
body:
I load a volume and train. 
Then I load additional volumes of different sizes. 
I delete all original label classes (by pressing the red cross next to the label classes). 
When switching between volumes, I no longer see the raw data. 
When adding new labels, their colors are not correct (it does not start with red / green) 
I can not add new annotations (which anyway doesn't make sense, given that the raw data is not visible)

title: Training applet: additional segmentation is updated only in current tile
body:
Zoom out such that several tiles are in field of view. Switch off all layers except for a segmentation layer and the raw data. 

Add annotations within a single tile only. 

Then only the segmentation in that single tile is updated.

title: spurious feature layers / not a showstopper
body:
Load two volumes 
compute features
label and predict interactively on one volume 
switch to the other and view a few predictions 
switch back to the first volume 
switch to feature app 

Now there are, in addition to the original, and fully functional, feature layers, some more redundant instances of the original feature layers. They are non-functional and show up as blank in the orthoviews.
